intro: Veronica bishopiana, commonly known as Bishop's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
